channel.title: Presentation on INSPIRE Lab @ UCF
channel.description: Recent content in Presentation on INSPIRE Lab @ UCF

item.title: Best Poster Award (2nd place) in INFORMS Annual Conference
item.description: INSPIRE LAB’s poster on Spatial Pricing of Ride-sourcing Services in a Congested Transportation Network received 2nd place in the poster competition in INFORMS Annual Conference 2021. Congratulations Fatima!

item.title: Best paper award (Energy Systems Track) in IISE Annual Conference
item.description: INSPIRE LAB’s paper on Impacts of Privately Owned Electric Vehicles on Distribution System Resilience: A Multi-agent Optimization Approach received best paper award in Energy System Track in IISE Annual Conference 2021. Congratulations Sina!

item.title: Presentation at IISE 2021
item.description: Dr. Guo will have one presentations at IISE Annual Conference 2021 (virtual). He will present the work, coauthor with his PhD student Sina Baghali, on impact of private electric vehicles on distribution system resilience on May. 24, 2021.

item.title: Presentation at TRB 2021
item.description: INSPIRE lab will present four of recent research at TRB 2021 (virtual): (1) spacitial (1) Statistical Modeling for Charging Behavior of Plug-in Delectric Vehicles using Large-Scale Charging Data; (2) A Stochastic Multi-Agent Optimization Framework for Interdependent Transportation and Power System Analyses; (3) Energy Impact Analyses of Electrified Ride-Sourcing Services without Trip-Chain Data; (4) Spatial Pricing of Ride-sourcing Services in a Congested Transportation Network.

item.title: Presentation at INFORMS 2020
item.description: INSPIRE lab will present two of recent research at INFORMs 2020 (virtual): (1) EV charging behavior study using large-scale supply-side charging data. (2) A Stochastic Multi-Agent Optimization Framework for Interdependent Transportation and Power System Analyses.

item.title: Presentation at INFORMS 2019
item.description: Dr. Guo will present two of his work on renewable generator planning and EV charging incentive design considering transportationa and power interdependency at INFORMs 2019 in Seattle.

item.title: Presentation at IISE 2019
item.description: Dr. Guo will have two presentations at IISE Annual Conference 2019 in Orlando, FL. He will present his work on Competitive Intermediate Facility Location Problems under Traffic Equilibrium on May. 19, 2019, and his work on Interdependence between Transportation and Power Systems, beyond Electric Vehicles on May. 20, 2019.

item.title: Presentation at USF CUTR seminar
item.description: Dr. Guo will present his work on a stochastic general equilibrium approach on market-based facility infrastructure development on Mar. 22, 2019 at USF.

item.title: Finalists in poster competition
item.description: INSPIRE LAB’s poster on Distribution Network Reconfiguration with Decentralized Autonomous Electric Vehicles was in the finalist (top 6) of the poster competition at the 2018 INFORMS Annual Meeting.

item.title: Presentation at INFORMS 2018
item.description: Dr. Guo will present his work, collaborating with Sandia National Labs and UC Davis, on evolvement of charging infrastructure in a competitive and stochastic market at INFORMs 2018 in Phoenix.
